alert.note: Alert for Hidalgo (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued January 11 at 11:56AM MST until January 11 at 2:00PM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... West central Hidalgo County in southwestern New Mexico... * Until 200 PM MST. * At 1154 AM MST, an area of blowing dust was over Steins, and reducing visibility along Interstate 10 between the Arizona state line and Lordsburg. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong winds up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Satellite imagery. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 22. Locations impacted include... Steins, Lordsburg, Road Forks, Lordsburg Playa, and Shakespeare. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... There is no safe place on a highway when a dust storm hits. Visibility can be lost immediately, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel, or safely exit the highway before the dust storm arrives. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
